qas.question: How will solar energy increase energy security?

answers.text: through reliance on an indigenous, inexhaustible and mostly import-independent resource

qas.question: What costs will solar energy lower?

answers.text: the costs of mitigating global warming

qas.question: What should the cost of incentives for producing solar energy be considered?
What effect will solar energy have on the price of fossil fuels?

answers.text: keep fossil fuel prices lower than otherwise

context: In 2011, the International Energy Agency said that "the development of affordable, inexhaustible and clean solar energy technologies will have huge longer-term benefits. It will increase countries’ energy security <a0_0>through reliance on an indigenous, inexhaustible and mostly import-independent resource<a0_0/>, enhance sustainability, reduce pollution, lower <a1_0>the costs of mitigating global warming<a1_0/>, and <a3_0>keep fossil fuel prices lower than otherwise<a3_0/>. These advantages are global. Hence the additional costs of the incentives for early deployment should be considered <a2_0>learning investments<a2_0/>; they must be wisely spent and need to be widely shared".
